course.subject: HUMA
course.name: Chinese Women on Screen
course.description: This course approaches Chinese women as both historical and fictional figures to unravel the complicated relationship between history and visual representation. Each week revolves around a special topic and a film about Chinese women located in a specific socio-historical period. This course is in chronological order, beginning from Republican women to contemporary female immigrants in the age of globalization. The changing images of women on screen went hand in hand with major cinematic movements in history, including the left turn in the 1930s, the rise of animation, socialist filmmaking, model opera film, underground/independent filmmaking, and the cinematic globalization. The purpose of this course is to build a foundation for students from different academic backgrounds who may have little or no knowledge of Chinese culture and history. Proficiency in Chinese is a plus but not required because all reading materials and class discussion are in English.

reviews.author: ccclee
reviews.title: Take only if you can stand Chinese propaganda
reviews.comment_content: The course consists of black and white Chinese movies, musicals and cartoons.  The exam was essay based, so don't take it if you hate writing.  If you're a movie goer, ok with Chinese history and want a relaxing film session once a week, I'd recommend this course.
reviews.comment_teaching: Professor's accent was a bit difficult to comprehend.  But most of the lessons were movie watching, so it wasn't that much of a problem.  She was a very genuine and likable woman.
reviews.comment_grading: Not bad if you can write.
reviews.comment_workload: LMES discussion board contribution, 2 exams, no projects.

reviews.author: ciserein
reviews.title: 非常輕鬆嘅靚grade course
reviews.comment_content:
內容基本上係關於中國電影之中涉及到嘅女性主義。
以下為2021 fall sem嘅課程情況/
課程相關必睇嘅電影：
- Chinese Women: The Great Step Forward—From Confucius to Mao 2001
- The Goddess 神女 1934 （阮玲玉主演黑白默片）
- New Women 新女性 1935 （阮玲玉主演黑白默片）
- Princess Iron Fan 鐵扇公主 1941 （抗日時制動畫）
- Spring in a Small Town 小城之春 1948 （文藝片）
- Five Golden Flowers 五朵金花 1959 （全彩電影）
- Spark of Life 生命的火花 1962 （以女性為主體嘅紅片）
- Red Detachment of Women 紅色娘子軍 1971 （紅色芭蕾舞劇）
- Woman, Demon, Human 人鬼情 1987 （戲曲相關劇情電影）
- Bingai 秉愛 2007 （紀錄片）
- Fish and Elephant 今年夏天 2001 （女同性戀相關劇情電影）
- Ermo 二嫫 1994 （劇情電影）
- Farewell China 愛在別鄉的季節 1990 （劇情電影）

呢一個course對participation要求比較高，professor問咗問題之後就會等人舉手（後期變咗zoom舉手鬥快）答，內容同次數會影響15%嘅participation分。
主要討論主題：
Cinematic Movements (including Left-wing cinema movement to Hong Kong Cinema)
Male gaze
Modern girl/ new women
Gender and sexuality
Women and nationalism
Cyborg
Women travel and mobility
Voice
Identity and the identification

個人感想：
課程內容其實係好好，真係能夠提得起興趣去聽。基本上係自己睇完電影之後上堂參與討論咁。 係為數不多我覺得真係有嘢入腦嘅堂。而且個人非常鍾意聽同女性主義topic相關嘅討論，課程內容對女性主義其實都幾有啟發。有幾部電影都特別好睇（新女性、人鬼情、愛在別鄉的季節）所以上得都好開心下。
reviews.comment_teaching:
為咗唔好俾人以為我係打手所以評少少嘢評成B，不過其實我心入面都係覺得prof Daisy佢教得真心唔錯，有心講，而且會參與討論俾評價。
不過主要接觸嘅都係TA，佢都好nice，都係會參與討論，而且佢係呢堂度真係做咗好多嘢，我見佢走嚟走去都覺得有少攰XD

好好嘅professor同好好嘅TA！
reviews.comment_grading:
評分準則：
• Attendance: 15% or F
  好簡單，就係上堂
• Participation: 15%
  個人建議每堂講兩至三次嘢，當然有時候唔係話你想講就講到， 加油
• Weekly quiz: 15%
  唔應該錯嘅quiz，所以答嘅時候睇清楚啲，唔好揀錯答案......
• A film review (200 words): 15%
  呢個film review係關於fish and elephant嘅，200字其實就唔係好夠寫嘅，最多都係講到某一part咁。個人唔建議寫同劇情相關嘅感想
• Final paper (800 words): 40%
  圍繞住以前上堂講嘅幾個topic i.e. mobility, identity and sexuality etc. 加上以前睇過嘅電影做例子去寫一篇800字嘅essay，其實800字都唔係好夠寫._.  篇essay其實唔係好看重你英文水平，主要係你跟唔跟佢準則寫，同埋你講唔講到你想表達嘅嘢

本人情況：
Attendance: 15/15
Participation: 平均每堂講三次嘢左右
Weekly quiz: 13.6/15...?
A film review (200 words): 13/15
Final paper (800 words): ?/40 到而家都唔知咩分

Final grading = A
識嘅人都係A range，所以真係好靚grade
reviews.comment_workload:
可以話佢係0 workload course。

我呢個sem冇final冇midterm，最多只係提早好多日俾你做份所謂叫midterm paper嘅film review同埋提早好多日俾你做份所謂叫final paper嘅essay，好快就做完。

課堂前準備，每星期提前睇完當星期要講嘅電影，如果有心可以睇埋每星期三份左右嘅reading material。我成個course加埋淨係睇咗6份，其實reading material影響唔大，最多係寫final paper嘅時候重要少少。

上堂嗰時，準備一隻可以好快撳到掣嘅手，同埋清醒嘅腦，每堂搶都三次嘢講就可以提早收工（建議聽埋落去）中途或者開始時會有quiz，非常簡單，睇你有冇睇過套電影咁解，都係嗰句，答嘅時候睇清楚啲，唔好揀錯答案......

reviews.author: biabiabili
reviews.title: Not Bad
reviews.comment_content: Interesting teaching materials, screening and discussion in the lesson.
reviews.comment_teaching: Good and nice Prof. Very responsive and encouraging.
reviews.comment_grading: You have to speak up to get good grade. I spoke around once per lesson, which was not as frequent as other classmates and it turns out just a B. I performed quite well in the assessments but the grade was not satisfying for me. Not good for introverted students.
reviews.comment_workload: Rather light compared to other courses. But the lecture was a bit too long for me in the morning 9. something zzz

reviews.author: duckieee
reviews.title: Very good grade course
reviews.comment_content:
An interesting course if you enjoy watching old films. Every week she will go through different topics like
- Prostitutes and the Nation in Republican China
- Modern Girl and New Women in Republican China
- Women, Wartime Nationalism, and Animation
- Female Voices from the Ruins of War
- Ethnic Girls and Socialist Comedy
- Women and Machines: Tractor Girls and Socialist Modernity
- Masculinization of Women during the Cultural Revolution
- Women Directors
- Gender, Forced Migration, and Independent Filmmaking

Apart from weekly schedules movie, she will also play a lot of interesting movie clips.
reviews.comment_teaching: Some would find her teaching boring but I think it’s acceptable. She will engage with classmates by asking them questions (mainly for class participation).
reviews.comment_grading: Very good!! I got A+ at the end
reviews.comment_workload:
Grading Criteria:
• Attendance: 15% or F
• Participation: 15%
• Weekly quiz: 15%
• A film review (200 words): 15%
• Final paper (800 words): 40%

Very light tbh. You can easily get full marks in participation when answering in total of 6 questions in class. The film review and essay also quite easy as only requires 200 n 800 words respectively. You only need to finish the weekly movie watching and you can also get full marks in the quizzes easily.

reviews.author: sleepingbag
reviews.comment_content: The course contains different aspect towards women on movie in different eras of China. You'll learn a little bit about movie techniques, and a lot about the roles that women play in different movies. There would be discussion about the social structure and the situation that women faced in different eras.
reviews.comment_teaching: The professor taught really well and encourage students to get involved in the discussion. She also explain each slide in detail and lead student to beware of the detail of different films.
reviews.comment_grading:
So most assignment other than the final report could get full mark if you hand-in the work. For final report it is the only thing that would influence your grade. I am not really familiar with writing these kind of reports about society and humanity and gender stuffs, so ends up with a B+. I guess others who have better writing on these topics and study thoroughly for those movies could get better mark.

Also it might be useful to get some advice from the TA about the final report.
reviews.comment_workload:
Answer the questions in the lecture to get the class participation mark.

Video review only requires 200 words.

Final report: Watch 3 movie and analyze them. The topics are given. 800 words.

reviews.author: hugochiu
reviews.comment_content:
Protagonist, Prostitutes and other women characters. Classmates are over 70% of females students, who are extremely aggressive in answering questions. They raise hands to answer every questions, in a really appreciable way I mean. I didn't answer any questions so far. But this really count the attendance score of 15%.
What we have to do is watching movies during lesson. Some are quite special which is in black and white. But to be truth, as a Hong Kong student, you do have an advantage of reading Chinese source. The foreign students would be less benefited in the sources.
reviews.comment_teaching: Um. To be truth, I am a bit frustrated in listening to professor words, possibly because of my poor English. XD But Isabel, the TA, is really helpful. She do give very useful advice and comments. Feel free to seek her help during consultation.
reviews.comment_grading: Um. As I have said, I didn't scored the attendance 15% marks. (As too many girls, I am timid ah) But I paid efforts in my final essay. I scored an A lastly.
reviews.comment_workload: Definitely a perfect course. Quiz is super easy in case you have friend in class. Those girls are really hard working, and helpful. For the film review, just watch the movie once. Try to use as much film vocabulary as you can. For the final essay, try to use a proper essay structure. This is the only thing you have to do.

reviews.author: busi trash
reviews.title: competitive, but 0 workload good grade cc
reviews.comment_content: see others, studying how chinese woman social status changed
reviews.comment_teaching:
sadly, i have to say i pay 0 attention to her class, could not comment on her teaching style

however, at least i know she is a kind and nice person, the ta as well
reviews.comment_grading:
attendance:     15%     full
participation:    15%    unknown, but i at least answer 3 times per lesson on zoom chatbox
quizzes:           15%    full, guess most of us are full
film analysis:    15%   (13/15, mean 13.7/15)
final essay:       40%  unreleased, but really only writing with my common sense

final grade -> A  , it totally surprised me cuz i dont think my essay is so insightful, most importantly, i included literally 0 terms or concepts taught from the course
reviews.comment_workload:
extremely light workload

participation: you get participation score once you answer the question regardless of your content, however, as participation weigh a lot in grading, everyone is fighting for the chance to answer, a lot of student (at least half of whole class) would raise hand immediately  (i mean with 0 second thinking) and answer the question, that is super competitve at first, but prof. allowed us to answer question on zoom chatbox later, so i get my participation score easily

quizzes: 1 mc q per lesson, you can definitely get the correct answer if you have watched the movie

film analysis: 200 words, too short for me to decide which part i could write about

final essay: 800 words, we got few topics to choose, mostly around the topics that we have discussed on class, not difficult to handle

reviews.author: wwwwwww
reviews.title: Good Grade !!
reviews.comment_content:
The course is about the changing images of women on screen with major cinematic movements in history, about underground/independent filmmaking, and the globalization of cinema in contemporary China.

All in all, take the course if you enjoy watching the female/feminist movies. I think this course is the most enjoyable course I have taken in university life.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Each lecture focuses on the analysis of one movie. You have to watch the assigned movie and read the assigned materials before attending the lecture

The ppt has little content. In order to understand the technical terms of filmmaking, you should pay attention to the lecture and most importantly the classroom discussion. Otherwise, you will get lost.

The lecture is mainly the classroom discussion. Professor will ask many questions and invite students to share their views. Each discussion topic spends at least 15 to 20 minus. There is no right and wrong answer so as long as you are willing to speak up, you can get the participation mark.

The lecture takes 3 hours long and you have to pay attention to the professor's questions during 3 hours and grab any opportunities to answer the questions in order to get a full participation mark. Students are very competitive so you should stay focused. It is quite stressful and exhausting after this 3-hour lecture. But I think you can get a full participation mark if you can speak at least 3 times each lecture.
reviews.comment_grading:
Grading Criteria:
• Attendance: 10% or F
Being 5 minutes late for class three times will be counted as one unexcused absence. Four or more unexcused absences will automatically lower your final grade to F.

• Participation: 10%
Better to speak at least three times per lecture. But sometimes it is hard to get the chance to speak because students are very competitive ... so you have to grab every chance to speak!

• Weekly quiz: 5%
The quiz is super easy. Only one question. No worries about the quiz. The purpose of the quiz is to force you to watch the film before class. As long as you know the story of the film, you can get a full mark.

• Mid-term paper (1000 words): 25%
The marking is quite lenient for the Mid-term paper. As long as you follow the instruction, you can get a good grade.

• A film analysis (500 words): 5%
It is very easy. Just analyze a film.

• Final paper (1000 words): 45%
The marking is much stricter than the mid-term paper. But I think as long as you fulfil the requirements, you can get a good grade easily.

The grade is very good!!! I got A+
reviews.comment_workload:
The workload is quite low.
- spend 2 hours watching the film every week (it is quite enjoyable if you like watching the film)
- spend 1.5 hours reading all the required articles and/or book chapters every week
• Quiz about required films every week (No need to prepare. Just watch the film and you will know how to answer the question)
• Mid-term and final papers
(Better to start working on the papers earlier but the paper is not difficult to handle)

reviews.author: ccwsw
reviews.comment_content:
- examines Chinese women as both historical and fictional figures
- study the relationship between history and visual representations
- includes Chinese women in Republican China and ending with contemporary female immigrants in the age of globalization
- key to understand the changing images of women on screen go hand in hand with major cinematic movements in history
- examples including leftist turn in the 1930s, the rise of animation in wartime Shanghai, socialist filmmaking during the Seventeen Years, the birth of model opera film during the Cultural Revolution, post-1989 underground/independent filmmaking, and the globalization of cinema in contemporary China - considers approaches of film analyses and gender/sexuality theories
- all reading materials, lectures, classroom discussions, and exams are in English.
reviews.comment_teaching:
- around 20 pages of slides per lecture
- one lecture per week
- the instructor delivers clear explanations on lecture materials
- with in-class film-watching session
reviews.comment_grading:
- answering questions in class is key to getting good grades
- average answering 2 questions per lecture
- nametags are required so the instructor gives out grades partly based on her impression to your class performance
- MC and essay questions for both mid-term and final exam
reviews.comment_workload:
- key terms for film analysis and Chinese women history should be studied for essay writings
- content, use of techniques as well as plots of each discussed films have to be studied
- answer questions for every lecture
- 2-3 reading materials per lecture

reviews.author: tiffanh
reviews.comment_content:
Talks about films and animation from the Republic China to Post-Mao China.
The lectures mainly talk about the history of China rather than film techniques.
reviews.comment_teaching: The professor is nice and she explains quite well. However, her accent is sometimes a bit difficult to follow.
reviews.comment_grading: I got an A. Most of my friends got B+ above. It is very easy to get an A range.
reviews.comment_workload:
- Attendance
- Participation
- Quiz
- Film review
- Midterm
- Final

The midterm and final exam is quite easy, you just have to attend the lesson and pay attention to what did she say. There are some reading materials, but I did not read it.

reviews.author: yooooooooo
reviews.title: Take it if you enjoy watching black and white movies
reviews.comment_content:
The course mainly focus on talking about the women, from black & white movies, cartoons and so on to those with colour and sound.  From the movie, we will discuss the the situation of those women and further expand them to real life at that period, e.g. Communist period, Post-Mao period. Every lesson, students have to watch one movie in the lecture. It's fun to watch them in the lectures.

Every lecture, Professor will give a pop up quiz (sometimes) which is really easy as it focus on the the movies that we have watch in the previous week. And the  Professor will ask questions and discuss with the students about the reading and movies. After that Professor will teach the background of that movies, the directors, the actors...Then we have a break and start to watch another movies!

And, as the movies are quite old, some movies shown in the lectures do not have English subtitles, so for foreign students, they have to borrow the CDs from the library which have English subtitles. So I recommend them think twice before reg this course or reg this course with friends.
reviews.comment_teaching: Professor' accent sometimes is hard to understand so you are not really clear what word she is talking about, but she will keep repeat those words again and again (as those are key points) which help you to answer the questions in exam more easily. She is a really nice Professor who encourage you to express your idea and feeling of that movie.
reviews.comment_grading:
The grade is quite good. I know how bad I write but finally get B+ (surprisingly).

Grading is depend on
~your engagement (how many times do you answer the questions in the lecture)
~attendance
~a mini quiz (most student can get full marks)
~midterm
~final
*in both midterm and final exam, there is MC, FILL IN THE BLANKS, SHORT QUESTION [which require you to watch a short scene that you should already watched before and you have to write down the movie name, director, year (around), and what films technique does it used and how it help to show the message of that movie], and LONG QUESTION [choose to answer one out of three questions, the questions are usually been discuss in the lecture so pay attention in the lectures]
reviews.comment_workload: Not much. The only thing that you have to do is to finish watching the moves after the lectures as usually there is not enough time to finish the whole movies in lecture time.
